bill_title: revise the scope of services provided by the state fire equipment shop and to authorize the shop to charge for costs incurred for rural fire assistance programs.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the scope of services provided by the state fire equipment shop and to authorize the shop to charge for costs incurred for rural fire assistance programs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-31-6 be amended to read as follows: 34-31-6. The secretary of agriculture or his designee Department of Agriculture shall operate a fire equipment shop to acquire and renovate equipment and distribute fire equipment, supplies and parts, that are not available through the Bureau of Administration, and federal and state excess vehicles and property to counties and volunteer rural fire departments for the suppression of rural fires. The department may charge recipients for reasonable direct and indirect costs of providing such rural fire equipment, vehicles, and supplies to counties and rural fire departments. The department may administer federal and state cost assistance programs related to such rural fire protection. The vehicles and property may be provided with clear title by the division to counties and volunteer fire departments , or the title may be retained by the state or federal government . Section 2. That § 34-31-8 be amended to read as follows: 34-31-8. Notwithstanding the provisions of § 5-23-2, the secretary of agriculture or his designee Department of Agriculture may purchase used motor vehicles and equipment at auctions of federal and state surplus property, or from public and private utility companies, irrespective of whether or not the sellers of said the vehicles are licensed dealers as required by § 5-23-2, for distribution to fire departments for fire suppression. The department may charge recipients for reasonable direct and indirect costs of providing such rural fire equipment, vehicles, and supplies to counties and rural fire departments. The department may administer federal and state cost assistance programs related to such rural fire protection. Section 3. That § 34-31-9 be repealed. 34-31-9. The secretary of agriculture may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 concerning: (1) The procedures for cost/share payments to the counties and volunteer fire departments; (2) The procedures for the acquisition and renovation of equipment; and (3) The procedures for the distribution of federal and state excess property.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the scope of services provided by the state fire equipment shop and to authorize the shop to charge for costs incurred for rural fire assistance programs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-31-6 be amended to read as follows: 34-31-6. The secretary of agriculture or his designee Department of Agriculture shall operate a fire equipment shop to acquire and renovate equipment and distribute fire equipment, supplies and parts, that are not available through the Bureau of Administration, and federal and state excess vehicles and property to counties and volunteer rural fire departments for the suppression of rural fires. The department may charge recipients for reasonable direct and indirect costs of providing such rural fire equipment, vehicles, and supplies to counties and rural fire departments. The department may administer federal and state cost assistance programs related to such rural fire protection. The vehicles and property may be provided with clear title by the division department to counties and volunteer rural fire departments , or the title may be retained by the state or federal government . Section 2. That § 34-31-8 be amended to read as follows: 34-31-8. Notwithstanding the provisions of § 5-23-2, the secretary of agriculture or his designee Department of Agriculture may purchase used motor vehicles and equipment at auctions of federal and state surplus property, or from public and private utility companies, irrespective of whether or not the sellers of said the vehicles are licensed dealers as required by § 5-23-2, for distribution to fire departments for fire suppression. The department may charge recipients for reasonable direct and indirect costs of providing such rural fire equipment, vehicles, and supplies to counties and rural fire departments. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the scope of services provided by the state fire equipment shop and to authorize the shop to charge for costs incurred for rural fire assistance programs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-31-6 be amended to read as follows: 34-31-6. The secretary of agriculture or his designee Department of Agriculture shall operate a fire equipment shop to acquire and renovate equipment and distribute fire equipment, supplies and parts, that are not available through the Bureau of Administration, and federal and state excess vehicles and property to counties and volunteer rural fire departments or districts for the suppression of rural fires. The department may charge recipients for reasonable direct and indirect costs of providing such rural fire equipment, vehicles, and supplies to counties and rural fire departments or districts. The department may administer federal and state cost assistance programs related to such rural fire protection. The vehicles and property may be provided with clear title by the division department to counties and volunteer rural fire departments or districts, or the title may be retained by the state or federal government . Section 2. That § 34-31-8 be amended to read as follows: 34-31-8. Notwithstanding the provisions of § 5-23-2, the secretary of agriculture or his designee Department of Agriculture may purchase used motor vehicles and equipment at auctions of federal and state surplus property, or from public and private utility companies, irrespective of whether or not the sellers of said the vehicles are licensed dealers as required by § 5-23-2, for distribution to fire departments or districts for fire suppression. The department may charge recipients for reasonable direct and indirect costs of providing such rural fire equipment, vehicles, and supplies to counties and rural fire departments or districts. The department may administer federal and state cost assistance programs related to such rural fire protection. Section 3. That § 34-31-9 be repealed. 34-31-9. The secretary of agriculture may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 concerning: (1) The procedures for cost/share payments to the counties and volunteer fire departments; (2) The procedures for the acquisition and renovation of equipment; and (3) The procedures for the distribution of federal and state excess property.
